Notification //for searchable part diseases name Search Healthy Food Care //anemia INTRO Anemia Is due to low number of red blood cells.In a routine blood test, anemia is reported as a low haemoglobin or hematocrit.Haemoglobin is the main protein in your Red Blood Cells. 

It carries oxygen,and delivers it throughout your body.If you have anemia,uou haemoglobin level will be low too. And even your tissue may not get enough oxygen. Anemia occurs when there are not enough red blood cells to carry oxygen to your bodys organs. As a result ,its a common to feel cold and symptoms of tiredness or weakness.

 Anemia is a medical condition in which the red blood cell count or the hemoglobin is less than normal.

 ●In men
 anemia is typically defined as hemoglobin level of less than 13.5 gram/100 ml; 
●In women
 as hemoglobin of less than 12.0 gram/100 ml. 

Anemia is caused by either a decrease in production of red blood cells (decreased erythropoiesis) or hemoglobin, or an increase in loss (usually due to bleeding) or destruction of red blood cells. //anemia sympt Initially, iron deficiency anemia can be so mild that it goes unnoticed. But as the body becomes more deficient in iron and anemia worsens, the signs and symptoms intensify.

Iron deficiency anemia signs and symptoms may include:
 ★ feel tired, ★ become easily fatigued, ★ have a feeling of a heart racing, ★feel short of breath, and ★ have worsening heart problems. ★ Unusual cravings for non-nutritive//substances,such as ice, dirt or starch name is required min name length is 3characters
Email field can not be empty Please enter a valid email

Leafy greens: Leafy greens, especially dark ones, are among the best sources of nonheme iron. They include:
 spinach,collard greens,dandelion greens. Seafood: Some seafood provides heme iron. Shellfish such as oysters, clams, scallops, crabs, and shrimp are good sources. Most fish contain iron. Other examples of calcium-rich foods include:
●dairy milk
●yogurt
●cheese Beans: Beans are good sources of iron for vegetarians and meat eaters alike. They’re also inexpensive and versatile.
Some iron-rich options are:
●kidney beans
●chickpeas 
●soybeans
●black beans Nuts and seeds: Many types of nuts and seeds are good sources of iron. They taste great on their own or sprinkled on salads or yogurt.
Some nuts and seeds that contain iron are: 
●pumpkin seeds
●cashews
●pistachios
●pine nuts
●sunflower seeds Cancer Is a disease in which cells in the body grow out of control. When cancer starts in the lungs, it is called lung cancer.
Lung cancer begins in the lungs and may spread to lymph nodes or other organs in the body, such as the brain. Cancer from other organs also may spread to the lungs. When cancer cells spread from one organ to another, they are called metastases. Symptoms Lung cancer typically does not cause signs and symptoms in its earliest stages. Signs and symptoms of lung cancer typically occur when the disease is advanced.
Signs and symptoms of lung cancer may include: ★ A new cough that doesnt go away ★ Coughing up blood, even a small amount ★ Losing weight without trying ★ Headache 
Healthy Diet for a Cancer Patient Choose protein-rich foods. Protein helps the body to repair cells and tissues. It also helps your immune system recover from illness. Include a source of lean protein at all meals and snacks. Good sources of lean protein include:
●Eggs 
●Soy foods 
●Nuts and nut butters 
● Lean meats such as chicken, fish, or turkey Eat fruits and vegetables every day. Fruits and vegetables offer the body antioxidants, which can help fight against cancer. Choose a variety of colorful fruits and vegetables to get the greatest benefit. Aim to eat a minimum of 5 servings of whole fruits and vegetables daily. Use good mouth care. Chemotherapy and radiation to the head or chest can irritate the lining of the mouth, throat, and esophagus. Brush your teeth with gentle toothpaste after eating and floss daily. Drink alcohol in moderation, if at all. Alcohol may contribute to dehydration, can lower the abilities of your immune system, and provides no beneficial nutrients. Is a cancer of the bodys blood-forming tissues,including the bone marrow and the lymphatic system.
Leukemia usually involves the white blood cells. Your white blood cells are potent infection fighters they normally grow and divide in an orderly way,as your body needs them . But in people with leukemia, the bone marrow produces abnormal white blood cells, which dont function properly. Leukemia is thought to occur when some blood cells acquire mutations in their DNA — the instructions inside each cell that guide its action.There may be other changes in the cells that have yet to be fully understood that could contribute to leukemia. Diet for a Leukemia Patient Eat Your Fruits and Vegetables: Aim for 5-10 servings of fruits and vegetables each day. One serving is half a cup for most fruits and veggies and one cup for leafy greens, melons and berries.
Drink Enough Water: Drinking enough water during cancer treatment is especially important because: 
★Liquids can help relieve fatigue or constipation
★Some treatment side effects, such as diarrhea or vomiting, can contribute to dehydration 
★Certain cancer therapies, including drug therapies and radiation therapy, can cause dehydration Make protein a priority. Its very important for patients with leukemia to get protein because it will keep them strong. If a hamburger doesnt appeal to you,try cooking something a little more bland, such as a piece of fish or chicken without much seasoning. It is a life-threatening mosquito-borne blood disease.The Anopheles mosquito transmits it to humans .The parasites in mosquitos that spread malaria belong to the Plasmodium genus.Over 100 types of Plasmodium parasite can infect a variety of species. What causes malaria? Malaria can occur if a mosquito infected with the Plasmodium parasite bites you. There are four kinds of malaria parasites that can infect humans: Plasmodium vivax, P. ovale, P. malariae, and P. falciparum. Symptoms of malaria Symptoms progress as follows, through cold, hot, and sweating stages: 
● a sensation of cold with shivering
●fever,headaches, and vomiting 
●sweats, followed by a return to normal temperature,with tiredness 
●seizures to younger people with the disease Diet to be eaten for Malaria patient Have a high protein diet This helps to protect the body and helps in the synthesis of immune bodies which will fight against parasites. Always take multivitamins Opt for B-complex, and minerals. Vitamin A and Vitamin C rich foods such as carrot,beetroots,papaya, fruits especially citrus fruits(e.g. orange,mausambi, pine apple,grapes,berries,lemon,etc), with vitamin B complex are very useful to boost immunity. Diet to be avoided for malaria patient ● Stay away from fats
●Spicy,fried and refined food should be avoided 
●Cake, pastries,maida should be avoided. 
●Avoid hot tea and coffee.
●Sauces and pickles should not be taken. Work on your carbs High carbohydrate diet should be taken that will digest quickly and will release energy. Goiter is a condition in which the thyroid gland grows larger.The thyroid gland is a small, butterfly-shaped gland located in the neck
The thyroid gland produces the hormones thyroxine(also called T4) and triiodothyronine (also called T3). What causes goiter? ●Simple goiters develop when the thyroid gland does not make enough hormones to meet the bodys needs. 
●Sporadic goiters, in most cases, have no known cause. In some cases, certain drugs can cause this type of goiter. 
●Endemic goiters occur in people in certain parts of the world who do not get enough iodine in their diet. Thyroid Superfoods Roasted seaweed Seaweed, such as kelp,nori,and wakame, are naturally rich in iodine—a trace element needed for normal thyroid function. Eat seaweed with sushi or get packaged seaweed snacks to toss in salads. Baked Fish Fish is rich in Omega-3 fatty acids and selenium, which both help decrease inflammation. Bake salmon, cod, sea bass, haddock, or perch for lunch or dinner to get a healthy dose of Omega-3s and selenium. Frozen yogurt Dairy products like yogurt,ice cream, and milk contain iodine.The thyroid needs iodine to prevent its glands from becoming enlarged—known as goiter.Treat yourself to a low-fat serving of frozen yogurt to get sufficient levels of iodine. This app is create inorder to give you information about Healthy and food diets.
And your not allowed to access the App without permission.HEALTHY FOOD CARE App it provides you the basic information which can help the society. Diabetes is a metabolic disease that causes high blood sugar. The hormone insulin moves sugar from the blood into your cells to be stored or used for energy. With diabetes, your body either doesn’t make enough insulin or can’t effectively use the insulin it does make. Symptoms of Diabetes ★increased hunger
★increased thirst
★frequent urination
★sores that don’t heal 
★blurry vision 
★weight loss Reasons for diabetes to occur ●When a person eats too much sugar or fructose the liver converts this into excessive fat that is accumulated in the body’s cells.As a result insulin receptors are becoming inefficient in absorbing sugar from the blood, and blood sugar levels stay
● Chronic inflammation is another mechanism that has been shown to cause insulin resistance. Obesity,the metabolic syndrome and diabetes have a common inflammatory denominator that results in insulin resistance. high. Diabetes Diets Recommendatios Eat Plenty of whole fruits and vegetables Cut out alcohol. Patients
